Create a Prioritizing Nature R Project

We covered the benefits of and how to create an project in R in Proyectos de R of Capacitación 3: Configuración de R y RStudio. We are now going to create one in the repository that we just downloaded end extracted.

  1. Open Rstudio.

  2. In the upper right, click on the drop menu that shows:

  1. In the dropdown menu that opens, select:

  1. In the window that opens, select Existing Directory:


  1. Click on Browse and then navigate the location of the directory you saved the downloaded repository files:


  1. Click Choose when you have entered the directory location.

  2. Finally, click on the Create Project button.

This will create an .Rproj in the directory, and Rstudio will now also show that the working directory has been set to the root of the directory. You can see this shown in the console window of Rstudio, which should look something like the image below:


Nota

The name of the project defaults to the name of the folder you create it but as with many things in R and Rstudio you can change it something you find more suitable.
